div.div:
In response to the COVID-19, otherwise known as Coronavirus, situation Lincoln Elementary 27 schools will not be in session tentatively until April 30th. Devices for Kindergarten - 5th grade students were sent home on April 10th and 11th so that students may begin Remote Learning on April 13th.
The Illinois State Board of Education requires schools to post their Plan for Remote Learning on the district website. Click the link to view our district's plan:
District 27 Remote Learning Plan for Students & Families
As a reminder, lunch and breakfast will continue to be provided to anyone 18 and younger during the school closure. These sack lunches can be picked up from 11:30 am to 12:00pm at one of these locations: the circle drive at Central Elementary, Northwest Elementary office and Washington-Monroe office.
Information regarding Remote Learning instruction can be found on the District #27 Remote Learning Site. If you have any questions about your child's work, please email their teacher. Email addresses can be found at each school's website under Staff Directory.
LESD #27 classes resume on April 13th. ECE-1st grade teachers have created Remote Learning Plans that are available at this link.Grades 2-8 lessons will be available on Google Classroom.
If students have a problem with their device, please fill out this form. They will be contacted to trouble-shoot the issue.
Students will needinternet to use the district provided device. Comcast is providing free internet to families who qualify. An application can be found at internetessentials.com. In addition, Comcast is offering free access to their Xfinity hotspots. Follow these steps:
How can I connect to an Xfinity WiFi hotspot?
Visitxfinity.com/wifior use the Xfinity WiFi Hotspots app to see a map of Xfinity WiFi hotspots. All open hotspots, both indoor and outdoor, will be displayed on the map in blue.
Once at a hotspot, customers and non-customers should selectxfinitywififrom the list of available WiFi networks, and then launch a browser.
Xfinity Internet customers can sign in using their Xfinity ID and password to be automatically connected to Xfinity WiFi hotspots in the future. Non-Xfinity Internet customers can connect by clicking theAccept and Connectbutton. Non-Xfinity customers will be able to renew their complimentary sessions every 12 hours.
Please help us figure out how to best meet your technology needs during this school closure by completing theTechnology in the Home - Survey.
We appreciate everyone's efforts during this situation. We will do our best to keep you informed of any changes.

304 Eighth Street, Lincoln, IL 62656
Phone 217-732-2522 | Fax 217-732-2198
